subject: Web3
title: Artists and Royalties
description: A fast breakdown of Artists and Royalties for builders.

hook.text: When a painting resells at auction, the original artist gets nothing. NFTs were supposed to change that.

buildup.text: Smart contracts can enforce automatic royalties. Every time an NFT resells, the creator gets a percentage.

discovery.text: This was revolutionary. For the first time, artists could earn from their work's increasing value.

twist.text: Marketplaces started making royalties optional to attract traders. Blur and others let buyers skip them.

climax.text: The royalty debate split Web3. Artists wanted enforcement; traders wanted lower costs. Nobody won cleanly.

punchline.text: NFTs promised artists lifelong royalties. The market said 'optional.'

quiz.question: What was the promise of NFT royalties for artists?
options: Automatic earnings every time their work resells
